business.headline: US markets rally as Dow Jones jumps 1,100 points, Nasdaq, S&P surge 3%The surge in US stocks came as investors looked for any indication that the US might be open to easing some of its tougher tariffs through negotiations.

Opting for new tax regime? Know about this Rs 7,000 post office savings benefitAs per a government notification issued back in 2011, interest from post office savings accounts is exempt under Section 10(15) of the Income Tax Act.

Sensex, Nifty end higher on global recovery and RBI rate cut expectationsThe S&P BSE Sensex added 1,089.18 points to close at 74,227.08, while the NSE Nifty5o gained 374.25 points to end at 22,535.85.

RBI MPC to announce decision on April 9: Will there be a rate cut?Since the last MPC meeting, held in February 2025, a lot of things have changed, both positive and negative. While inflation has come down, and growth has started to pick up, there are fresh worries about the global economy.

'Economic nuclear war': Billionaire business titans slam Trump's tariff gambitDonald Trump's tariff agenda is fracturing elite support, with top businessmen — from Bill Ackman to Jamie Dimon — warning it risks recession, inflation, and global instability.

Hotmail co-founder Sabeer Bhatia on Indian engineers: '99% start giving gyaan'Sabeer Bhatia pointed out that in India, people respect those who talk business, not those who write code or build software. This mindset, he says, is stopping India from becoming a hub of innovation.

Sensex up 1,600 points: Which stocks are driving the rally on Dalal Street?Markets saw a huge rebound from yesterday's crash as they staged a robust recovery as no stocks on the Sensex of Nifty50 traded in red in the afternoon session.

Trump's tariff war may backfire, says JPMorgan CEO, urges stronger India tiesJPMorgan CEO, Jamie Dimon, explained that higher costs of imported goods would affect consumers, while increased demand for local products could also drive prices up.

Unified Pension Scheme: Centre studying global models to manage UPS pool corpusThe government aims to create proper rules for investing the extra contribution made by it in a separate pension fund called the pool corpus under the newly launched Unified Pension Scheme (UPS).

Japan's Nikkei leads Asia's recovery as hopes rise for softer tariff approachA 5.6% rebound in Japan's Nikkei far outpaced other regional markets, with Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Trade Representative Jamieson Greer tasked with leading trade negotiations with Tokyo.

Explained: Why Titan share price jumped 7% after hitting 52-week lowThe recovery in Titan share price came just a day after the stock touched its 52-week low of Rs 2,947.55. In the morning session, Titan shares climbed to a high of Rs 3,222, providing some relief to investors after a tough few months.

Sensex, Nifty in green: Why is stock market rising today? 3 things to knowSensex, Nifty today: Tracking global markets that showed signs of recovery, Sensex and Nifty surged more than 1.5% in early trade, shaking off fears that had weighed heavily just a day earlier, with early buying seen across most sectors.

entertainment.headline: Music icons Madonna, Elton John bury old hatchet: A healing momentMusic titans Madonna and Elton John have ended their decades-long feud after the former artiste paid a visit to John post-performance. Madonna shared a post about the same on her social media handle.
Logout trailer: Babil Khan's thriller is a wake-up call on phone addictionBabil Khan starring Logout trailer released on April 8. The film will premiere on Zee5 on April 18.

Alia Bhatt's latest ad has fans calling her Madhuri Dixit's 'unofficial daughter'Bollywood star Alia Bhatt's latest ad is trending on social media, where she is channelling a 90s vibe. The actor's avatar in the commercial is being praised by fans, with many comparing her with a younger Madhuri Dixit.
SRK, Suhana Khan's King delayed due to script setback: ReportShah Rukh Khan and Suhana Khan's King is reportedly delayed amid script changes. The film is expected to release in theatres in 2026.

Krrish 4: Hrithik Roshan in triple role, reuniting with Preity Zinta | ExclusiveActor Hrithik Roshan will most likely be seen in a triple role in the next Krrish film. The movie will also see him sharing screen space with close friend Preity Zinta once again.

Chef Vikas Khanna backs actor Gaurav Khanna as he gets trolled for copying a dishActor Gaurav Khanna faced criticism over the originality of his dessert on Celebrity MasterChef. However, chef Vikas Khanna has now come out in support of the actor and extended his best wishes to all the contestants of the season.
Govinda's wife Sunita Ahuja gets angry over divorce rumours: Dogs will barkGovinda's wife Sunita Ahuja reacted to divorce rumours. Angry with the rumours, Ahuja said, 'dogs will bark.'

Now You See Me: How the magical heist franchise was ahead of its timeThe Now You See Me franchise introduced audiences to a world where magic and heists collided, offering a fresh twist on the crime genre. Before the third film hits the theatres, let us delve into why and what made this franchise stand out.

Allu Arjun turns 43: Icon star greets fans outside his homeTelugu superstar Allu Arjun's birthday turned into a grand fan celebration on Tuesday. A sea of fans gathered outside his residence in Hyderabad, and the actor was seen greeting the crowd and waving to them warmly.

TAPS: How a YouTube film is broadening the understanding of queer lives A short film on YouTube, titled 'TAPS', has travelled across the world through various film festivals. Backed by Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal, it became one of the most seamlessly designed films on gay relationships in India.

Filmmaker Alfonso Cuaron in talks to direct new James Bond movieAcclaimed director Alfonso Cuaron is reportedly in talks to direct the next James Bond movie. While an official announcement is yet to be made, the filmmaker hinted about the project during a recent event.

5 reasons why Allu Arjun and Atlee's big-budget actioner could be a game-changerThe announcement video of Allu Arjun's next with Atlee was more than a birthday special teaser - it offered a glimpse into one of Indian cinema's most ambitious projects. Built with global technicians and futuristic storytelling tools, the mega-budget actioner aims to set a new benchmark for mainstream Indian entertainment.

Influencer Apoorva Mukhija's powerful post, her first after Latent row, police casesYouTuber Apoorva Mukhija broke silence and spoke about receiving death and rape threats after India's Got Latent controversy. The actor shared her first post after wiping her social media clean following the backlash.
John Lithgow wins best actor at Olivier Awards for role in GiantJohn Lithgow won Best Actor at the Olivier Awards 2025 for his role in Giant, exploring Roald Dahl's dark legacy.

Pulse review: Charming, and strictly for fans of Grey's AnatomyReleased-Fri Apr 04, 2025The new Netflix medical drama, 'Pulse', has got nothing new to offer, but it's an easy watch - like background noise you can follow while doing chores. With Willa Fitzgerald and Colin Woodell leading the series, it certainly is a good-looking show.

Saif Ali Khan teams up with Hansal Mehta for Black River adaptation, confirms authorAfter Jewel Thief, actor Saif Ali Khan collaborated with Hansal Mehta for the adaptation of the book Black River. Its author, Nilanjana Roy, confirmed the news.

Prabhas's The Raja Saab to release in November? Director Maruthi shares updateDirector Maruthi recently shared photos of himself visiting temples in Tirupati and Srikalahasti in Andhra Pradesh. A curious fan asked for an update about the film's release.

The Phoenician Scheme trailer: Wes Anderson promises absurd drama with A-list castHollywood's acclaimed director Wes Anderson is back with another quirky movie, this time, featuring a star-studded cast. The Phoenician Scheme releases this summer.

Robert De Niro to receive Lifetime Achievement Award at 78th Cannes festivalCelebrated actor Robert De Niro will receive an honorary Palme d'Or for his lifetime achievements at the 78th Cannes Film Festival. This marks a significant return for De Niro, who has a rich history with the festival.

general news.headline: Kalyan Banerjee's tirade against 'rude female MP' as Trinamool feud goes publicA bitter feud between Trinamool lawmakers came into public after the BJP's IT Cell in charge Amit Malviya shared a video and screenshots of a heated exchange between them.

Waqf Act comes into force days after Parliament passage, President's nodThe Waqf Amendment Act, 2025, officially comes into effect today, marking a significant update to the legal framework governing waqf properties in India.

No, Mamata doesn't need to go to jail for Bengal teachers. Here's a way outOver 25,000 teachers lost their jobs in West Bengal after a Supreme Court ruling on a tainted recruitment process. The list includes scores of candidates who made it on merit and their lives have been upended. CM Mamata Banerjee said she was ready to go to jail for them. Mamata doesn't need to go to jail, but do something simple to save thousands of families from financial ruin.
Gold biscuit to wedding saree, bizarre things Indians left behind in Uber cabsMumbai has dethroned Delhi as the most forgetful city in India, according to Uber's 9th Annual Lost & Found Index.

Pooran, Marsh fireworks hurt KKR in Eden thriller as LSG climb to top fourIPL 2025, KKR vs LSG: Kolkata Knight Riders lost a high-scoring thriller to Lucknow Super Giants by 4 runs. Nicholas Pooran and Mitchell Marsh's fireworks helped the visiting team post a winning total of 238 at Eden Gardens on Tuesday, April 8.

US markets rally as Dow Jones jumps 1,100 points, Nasdaq, S&P surge 3%The surge in US stocks came as investors looked for any indication that the US might be open to easing some of its tougher tariffs through negotiations.

Canada raises minimum wages, Indians, in particular, will benefitAmid the high cost of living in Canada, the increase in the minimum wage in the private sector might bring some relief to those in temporary jobs, especially Indian students. Since April 1, the minimum wage has been raised from 17.30 Canadian dollars to 17.75 per hour.

Influencer Apoorva Mukhija's powerful post, her first after Latent row, police casesYouTuber Apoorva Mukhija broke silence and spoke about receiving death and rape threats after India's Got Latent controversy. The actor shared her first post after wiping her social media clean following the backlash.
Cars torched, stones thrown as Waqf protest turns violent in BengalA large crowd had gathered to demonstrate against the Waqf Act when a clash broke out between the protesters and police.

In Telangana, a battle over my tree vs your treeThe Telangana government has sparked a massive row with its attempt to clear 400-acres of forest land next to the University of Hyderabad and auction it. Team Revanth Reddy is now engaged in a tree-for-tree battle with KCR's BRS, blaming it for felling 12 lakh trees.

Digvesh Rathi unveils new celebration after fines, dismisses idol NarineLucknow Super Giants (LSG) wrist spinner Digvesh Rathi brought out his new celebration after dismissing his idol Sunil Narine in the game against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR).

Video: UP man lies on track, lets train pass over him for Instagram reel; arrestedIn Unnao, Uttar Pradesh, a youth named Ranjeet Chaurasia risked his life by lying on a railway track to shoot a reel, as a train passed over him. He added a song from Shah Rukh Khan's film Baadshah to the video and shared it on Instagram, seeking fame.

Tech, tradition, political timing: Modi's Pamban Bridge symbolism that few missedWhether the new bridge becomes a lasting symbol of integration or remains a contested marker of central messaging will depend on public memory and political tides

Cannot sit on bills: Top court raps Tamil Nadu Governor, clears 10 pending billsIn a landmark ruling, the Supreme Court declared that Governors cannot indefinitely delay action on bills, calling such inaction unconstitutional and illegal.

Axe is out for parody, Justin Trudeau's Ego to be hurtX, formerly Twitter, is full of parody accounts of Donald Trump, Justin Trudeau, Narendra Modi and even its owner, Elon Musk. From April 10, such accounts must use different profile pictures and add words like 'parody' or 'fake' to their handle names. Though some are slamming this kill-joy move, others are saying this was much-needed.
Dead for 10,000 years: The science behind resurrecting dire wolvesThe project marks the first successful de-extinction of a species and redefines possibilities for conservation.

Cops suspect Pak spy agency behind grenade attack outside BJP leader's Punjab homeA Punjab top cop said that a Pakistan-based man is among the key conspirators of the attack at BJP leader Manoranjan Kalia's house in Jalandhar.
How a house is holding up the Delhi-Dehradun ExpresswayThe Delhi-Dehradun Expressway is almost ready, but a legal dispute around a two-storey house is delaying the grand opening.

JEE candidates say they missed exam as Pawan Kalyan's convoy blocked wayOver 20 JEE aspirants in Visakhapatnam allegedly missed their exam due to traffic delays reportedly caused by Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan's convoy. However, the police denied the allegation, but Kalyan's office ordered an inquiry into the incident.
Make the most of your dating app this yearAs dating apps innovate to fundamentally alter the way to connect romantically, these pro tips will help you stay ahead in the game

Stand down: Mamata Banerjee's 'no interviews diktat' as Trinamool MPs squabbleTrinamool Congress was left red-faced after BJP shared a leaked video and screenshots of a fiery exchange among prominent lawmakers of the party.
What new Delhi EV policy means for people of national capitalWe tell you what the EV Policy 2.0 holds for the people of Delhi. Will you be able to continue your vehicle and how?

Three of world's top 5 slowest cities are in India, reveals study. Check rankingThree Indian cities are among the world's 5 slowest cities for traffic, according to TomTom's 2024 Index, with commute times exceeding 34 minutes per 10 km. The study also revealed that people in these cities lost 111.67 hours (on an average) annually due to rush-hour gridlock.

Nicholas Pooran and Mitchell Marsh's fireworks helped the visiting team post a winning total of 238 at Eden Gardens on Tuesday, April 8.

Women's ODI World Cup Qualifiers 2025: Squads, all you need to knowSix teams will fight for the remaining two spots in the Women's ODI World Cup when the Women's ODI World Cup Qualifiers 2025 gets underway on Wednesday, April 9 in Pakistan.

KKR vs LSG: Rishabh Pant angry at Shardul Thakur after 5 consecutive widesRishabh Pant was left angry at Shardul Thakur as the LSG pacer bowled five straight wides during the clash against KKR at the Eden Gardens in Kolkata. The LSG bowlers weren't disciplined during the second innings.

NHL: Kraken edge out Kings in a thriller 2-1 showdownThe Seattle Kraken edged out the Los Angeles Kings in a thriller, 2-1 on Monday, 7 April. Matty Beniers and Brandon Montour scored 54 seconds apart late in the first period.

New Chris Gayle? Nicholas Pooran continues IPL 2025 form, smashes 36-ball 87 vs KKRIPL 2025, KKR vs LSG: Nicholas Pooran hit a 36-ball 87, smashing eight sixes in an entertaining knock in Kolkata. The West Indies star, retained for Rs 21 crore, has taken his tally this season to 288 runs in five matches.

Digvesh Rathi unveils new celebration after fines, dismisses idol NarineLucknow Super Giants (LSG) wrist spinner Digvesh Rathi brought out his new celebration after dismissing his idol Sunil Narine in the game against Kolkata Knight Riders (KKR).

Travis Head denies fan's selfie request while shopping: 'Showing too much attitude'Australia and Sunrisers Hyderabad (SRH) batter Travis Head denied a fan's selfie request while shopping. He was pestered by a fan continuously for a photograph.

Rishabh Pant, don't act like MS Dhoni: Fans mock LSG captain for 'hiding' vs KKRRishabh Pant's decision to demote himself during the KKR vs LSG clash saw him get trolled by fans on social media on Tuesday, April 8. Pant didn't come out to bat as LSG scored 238 runs at the Eden Gardens.

MLB: Trump praises Ohtani's looks, takes jab at unnamed senators during Dodgers' White House visitPresident Donald Trump met the Los Angeles Dodgers at the White House on Monday, April 7, following their World Series victory over the New York Yankees, praising Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani and delivering a pointed remark about certain senators.

Ruturaj will grow as captain, won't single him out for CSK calls: Shane WatsonIPL 2025: Legendary all-rounder Shane Watson defended Ruturaj Gaikwad against criticism, saying the young captain will get better with more matches under his belt as CSK captain.

Rishabh Pant, don't act like MS Dhoni: Fans mock LSG captain for 'hiding' vs KKRRishabh Pant's decision to demote himself during the KKR vs LSG clash saw him get trolled by fans on social media on Tuesday, April 8. Pant didn't come out to bat as LSG scored 238 runs at the Eden Gardens.

MLB: Trump praises Ohtani's looks, takes jab at unnamed senators during Dodgers' White House visitPresident Donald Trump met the Los Angeles Dodgers at the White House on Monday, April 7, following their World Series victory over the New York Yankees, praising Dodgers star Shohei Ohtani and delivering a pointed remark about certain senators.

Ruturaj will grow as captain, won't single him out for CSK calls: Shane WatsonIPL 2025: Legendary all-rounder Shane Watson defended Ruturaj Gaikwad against criticism, saying the young captain will get better with more matches under his belt as CSK captain.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
